website_summaries.verdict: If all you seek in a home espresso machine is the odd cappuccino or latte, then the budget-minded DeLonghi EC155 Pump Espresso is tempting. However aficionados won't be impressed by its erratic coffee quality.
pros: The DeLonghi EC155 Pump Espresso is compact, affordable and makes very tasty espresso-based drinks paired with steamed milk
cons: Unfortunately the DeLonghi EC155 lacks the power and temperature control to pull consistently delicious espresso shots
The machine also has trouble extracting flavor from medium and lightly roasted beans

customer_reviews.title: Used to be good, now it's junk
customer_reviews.text: We bought one of these back in 2009, and it lasted seven years, did a fine job. When it started dying (struggling with pressure) we got another, and what a piece of junk.the second one was, both for steaming milk and making espresso. Even brand new it was working worse than the dying one. Maybe they switched to cheaper parts? The new one had been on the shelf as a backup, so it was too late to return. I went with the Mr. Coffee machine instead, and it's been way better. This DeLonghi machine is junk.
customer_reviews.author: Watergal

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad machine but much better value to spend a little more.
customer_reviews.text: Too long of a story but I’ll opine, decent for a budget machine but from experience, buy a breville express with built in grinder and quality tamper for the depressurized portafilter. Add a milk frother as only the much more expensive machines have decent boilers. It will be a much better value, not cost much more and take up less space.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: The EC-155 initially worked well and made good espresso. After 3 months
customer_reviews.text: The EC-155 initially worked well and made good espresso. After 3 months, It developed a water leak at the bottom of the unit that would flood the counter top when the water container was inserted. I suspect that the pressure water hose at the bottom of the unit has developed a split or hole but am unable to remove the bottom plate to check it out as I don't have the specialized tool to remove it. I checked DeLonghi's website and they don't list this leaking condition in their FAQ section. Sent a summary of this problem to DeLonghi and I am awaiting a response. James
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Weak, watery, gross shots
customer_reviews.text: This product was awful. The espresso shots were extremely weak. Every espresso shot was super watery, the machine is not easy to use. I am a barista at a local coffee shop, so I have 1000s of hours of experience pulling shots, steaming milk, etc. The steam wand did not work upon arrival. It spurted out some water droplets and did not steam the milk I had for it. The espresso was repulsive. Extremely weak and water shots. I tried 5 different espresso blends, trying to see if it was just what I was using, and it wasn’t. Will be returning. Please don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: J Cheshier

customer_reviews.title: Not a durable product.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on May 2016. Died on April 2018. I keep this machine clean, regularly run a cleaning cycle and for about half a year it was not even used. First the water wouldn't run through the coffee no matter what the grind size was or how loose it was packed. The pump seemed to loose force. Then after it started working again I barely got 4 cups out of this machine before the heating element broke and now all I can get is cold coffee. The machine doesn't even get hot to or warm to the touch.
customer_reviews.author: Anna H

customer_reviews.title: Two deliveries -- all machines were USED!!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this machine earlier this week and found water inside the machine, which indicated it was used before. I returned it and ordered another one. I just received the second machine, and it has water in the tank again and also there are some scratches on the side! I understand that some people returned the machine, but if it was used before, please sell it as a used machine. Two times of receiving used machines is so frustrating as each time, I need to go to a store to return.
customer_reviews.author: to21

customer_reviews.title: and it works great. The first time you make espresso with the ...
customer_reviews.text: My wife uses this espresso maker everyday, and it works great. The first time you make espresso with the machine will be a learning process, but it's not rocket surgery. Follow the directions included and you should be fine. Don't believe all the propaganda about tamping to exactly 35lbs of pressure or using a coffee grinder everytime you brew. All of that is nice, but this machine works fine without overly complicating things. Follow the instructions...or watch a youtube video if you don't like reading. Your espresso will, most likely, turn out fine. The best part will be you didn't spend $500 on an espresso machine ... which may make your beverage even more tasty.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for a short while only
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for about 10-20 uses. Then the pump stopped working. I let it run for about 20 minutes and then it worked again, but then it stopped working completely. The machine would just continue to vibrate as the pump is on. No water comes out at all. This machine did not last long enough to be worth it. It’s common enough to have a website show you how to replace the pump.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Lu

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect long life.
customer_reviews.text: I love the espresso from this machine. I like that it takes up little counter space. Why only 3 stars? In spite of performing all the recommended maintenance and cleaning, I have never had this machine last longer than one year before the pump goes out. I have purchased 3 of these in the past 3 years. My third one, one year old, just bit the dust. Perhaps time to consider something different.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Decent for price
customer_reviews.text: This machine is pretty good for the price. But there are a few things to note: espresso glasses and frothing cup are not included. The attached temper isn’t great so I suggest purchasing that separately as well. The space between the portafilter and base is small so only an espresso glass will fit under. The machine vibrates a lot so you need to hold the espresso glasses in place while you pull a shot. The frothing arm is short. All in all it gets the job done if you have the right accessories.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Dash

customer_reviews.title: I don't like the changes to this Model
customer_reviews.text: Had this same model for years and it worked very well, but it gave up the ghost. I like to drip into my coffee cup, but the new model doesn't allow for the height of my mug (standard mug size) Also my stainless frothing pitcher doesn't fit under the frothing wand. Otherwise the machine makes espresso as previously, a pretty good pull. If I thought there was another similar machine I would probably return this, but I don't see a comparable alternative.
customer_reviews.author: E B

customer_reviews.title: Great machine owned for one year makes an amazing cappuccino.
customer_reviews.text: I have made countless drinks with this little guy. It is great. I have owned it for a year. In this time the aerator cracked, just the tip piece. I called the customer service hotline, they took care of everything they were very nice and checked the complaint on their record, as it was close to not being under warranty they told me they would cover the entire machine if the tip didn't fix the problem. Great service is rare and a great machine with a great price?! Sold for life.
customer_reviews.author: Trex

customer_reviews.title: Does my coffee well with a bit extra vibration... which concerns me.
customer_reviews.text: I like it, It makes good espresso and foams the milk well...but... The clearance is small about 2.5" so it is hard to fit a cup in there. You can remove the drip tray, but it still won't take a normal coffee cup... I guess I need to go find a second hand cappuccino cup somewhere. Also, I'm not wild about how it vibrates when dispensing the espresso. It is sort of comical to see the cup vibrating and dancing around under the dispenser. I wonder though: does the vibration indicate that something is wrong with the pump mechanism? Still, the coffee comes out nicely and I feel good about that. I hope the vibration doesn't mean it won't last.
customer_reviews.author: wholegoose

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value, a little short
customer_reviews.text: Perfect espresso and ristretto. Note that the clearance is 66 MILLIMETERS. I mean I didn't expect 66 inches :). That's about 2.5 inches to be safe. My 2 5/8 inch shot glass needs to be "hooked" under the spouts. Other than that, awesome brew, awesome control. I don't usually do milk but theb2 cappucini I've made have been really good too. Good for long and short pulls. Good crema with the right packing pressure. The tamper is a little awkward, but ok for me. You might want a separate one, especially if you are storing glasses on top of the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Gerhard J. Feichtinger

customer_reviews.title: Not your local espresso café
customer_reviews.text: This is actually my second one of these. I really liked the first one for making a fairly decent espresso, until it wore out. This one has been weak from the start, and I basically use it to steam my milk. I should have asked for a replacement, but did not, probably because of just being too busy at the time. The pressure is just not strong enough to make a really good espresso.
customer_reviews.author: Hāweo

customer_reviews.title: what a waste
customer_reviews.text: This espresso machine was a disappointment. The drips for the espresso are really low and allow little room for even the smallest of cups. The frothing wand has little maneuverability and leaves a mess all over the machine and counter when using. There is also a plastic tip over the wand that makes for difficult clean up. The dampener offers little function due to placement on the machine. I used a Brevia before this and I must say it was a much better design. This machine was easy to use controls wise, but not practical in design.
customer_reviews.author: Venita DeLeon

customer_reviews.title: Great For Espressso / Cappuccino Not So Much
customer_reviews.text: This is my 6th machine. I've owned both high end and cheap machines. I have a big problem with this one. It allows an unacceptable amount of water into the milk during frothing. I've experimented with a number of wait times and line purging, but even at its best, it's not good enough. I also do not like the spring loaded frothing wand. I like to blow the line out into a towel after frothing, but this thing snaps back into the brewing area. If you drink straight espresso, you'll like this machine. It brews nicely, and I love the water tank design. Unfortunately, I'm all about the steamed milk. It's so cheap, I'll probably keep it as a backup.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Vesel

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners! Good value, nothing advanced
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. Frother works nicely. However, it doesn’t pull the most quality shots. The crema is there, but the flavor is just not quite right. Very disappointing that this doesn’t come with accessories to steam the milk with or to catch the shots. I did tons of research on espresso machines and decided on this one because of the value and price of the product. Overall, not bad for the price. Gets the job done, but might be worth investing in something a little nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Brynn

customer_reviews.title: 9 years and 2 days old and still works fine
customer_reviews.text: I just got back from a vacation to Sicily and thought about upgrading this machine, so I looked on Amazon, while I enjoyed by second cup of the day from my machine. I was quite surprised to see, from Amazon, that I bought it in July 2009. I'm getting old and time is flying. I guess I'd rather have one of those $4,000 machines that looks so cool, but this is still working fine for me after 9 years. Anything that costs $100 and brings me pleasure for 9 years, earns 5 stars. I'll wait on the fancy machine and save my dollars for another trip to Italy.
customer_reviews.author: Western Mass guy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Came on time and works perfect. Very easy to use and makes great espresso. I havent used the milk frothing, because I only drink espresso (not cappuccino). Follow the instructions about giving it ample time to heat up. Thats just part of the process of making good espresso (its not a limitation of the machine). Great machine for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: De'Longhi makes the best espresso machines!!! 2x lover of De'Longhi!
customer_reviews.text: I had my last De'Longhi for over 10 years!!! and it is still working but I could tell it needed replacing. Does anyone make things to last this long anymore? Just used my new one and love it just as much! Smooth coffee/espresso and the foamer does an excellent job and puts a thick topping of foam that lasts to the end of the cup. I guess you can use it with the prepackaged cups of ground coffee but I prefer fresh ground. The ultimate cup of java! Play it again, Sam!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Berger

customer_reviews.title: Worth it for the price point.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in Dec 2016. It made its last cup of espresso the other day. It wasn’t the best option but made a good espresso while it lasted. The most frustrating thing about the machine was that you had to hold the cups in place or they would vibrate off the platform and your espresso would end up in the tray. For the price point it was worth what I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: MME

customer_reviews.title: A Great Cup of Coffee
customer_reviews.text: OK, this machine will do espresso. It will foam the milk, including soy milk if that is what you want. For me, however, most mornings I jsut want a cup of really strong tasty coffee, about 6 ounces of the stuff. I want it hot, and when I am done with one cup, I usually want another one. This machine is perfect for that. No pods, filters, or other stuff that clogs the landfill. You just measure good coffee, tamp it, follow directions and oiut comes perfect coffee! Forget those other brands. I have used French press, filter cones and all manner of other things until my wife talked me into this one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E. Tigar

customer_reviews.title: No impressed
customer_reviews.text: The machine itself is to light. To attach the filter requires some force and the machine slides around during this process. Very awkward. The grounds won't press tightly because of some weird gasket....the end result is a little cup of coffee that tastes unremarkable for a lot of frustration. I was originally going to purchase the breville but the reviews for this machine had me hoping for a good espresso for less money. Lesson learned. The breville is expensive but I know what a great product it delivers and I really love my morning kick so I'll go with what I know.
customer_reviews.author: private

customer_reviews.title: A definite improvement over the preceding model
customer_reviews.text: After 10 years of faithful service my old Delonghi espresso maker broke a seal and started to leak. This machine is a big step forward from the old one in every way; more compact, faster, more pressure and sleeker design. The only drawback is it will not drip into a full sized coffee cup so not ideal for making a macchiato and requires a small espresso cup for making a cappuccino.
customer_reviews.author: Lee from NY

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: For this price, I think it is a great product. It makes a great cup of espresso and it is very easy to use. It is loud when making the shot and shakes. You might have to steady the cup with ur hands as the shot is pouring. The steaming wand is low to the counter so getting ur frothed milk out from under it can be difficult if you dont have the right sized pitcher. (I saw in reviews that some people set their machine on a raised surface to help with that) You also cant just push a button and go, it is an involved process, but for me, that is part of the fun of it.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Buying another one
customer_reviews.text: That this is the 3rd one we bought in 7 years tells you a couple things These don't last forever, but their price point and functionality (particularly for simple espressos) are worth the few years you get out of them. On average we make 4-5 large espressos every day, and the first two units lasted over 3 years each. We may have gotten more out of them if we descaled/cleaned more regularly. They make a fine crema, and if you are primarily interested in espresso, then this does as fine a job as a $500 machine. Once again we considered better machines and will end up getting another one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Derek R.

customer_reviews.title: Really Good Espresso Machine
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good espresso machine. It has the power to pull good shots. There are two things that I think are important to do that: 1) Just use a "normal" drip coffee grind (not super-fine espresso grind). The way the basket/filter cup is created it really doesn't need espresso grind. 2) Run a few water-only warm-ups so that by the time you do your pull the machine is really hot. If you do these two things you'll realize a good shot.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and makes a great espresso
customer_reviews.text: Great little espresso maker and great value. The only negatives I found is that for the first month or so, turning the button on top for the steam/frothing was very hard- it was like it was stuck and it just took some time to loosen it up. Now it’s fine. The space where the espresso comes out is very short, so I just use a special short bowl instead of my coffee cup. I use Lavazza Crema e gusto coffee and its wonderful! Caio ~
customer_reviews.author: Laura Fisk

customer_reviews.title: Reliable in long lasting
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned this unit since March 2018 and use it 3 to 4 times daily every since I bought it. Coffee still gets super hot and the pump is as strong as the 1st cup. I had to replace the filter a couple times after it got blocked up But besides that the machine and its components internal has been absolutely phenomenal. I’m impressed just because I used to buy the Mr. coffee espresso maker and found that I had to replace it every 12 months but this unit has definitely maintained.
customer_reviews.author: Lealah

customer_reviews.title: Year 2 cleaning, a necessity!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this machine for two years and it slowed down recently, not making espresso as quickly as it used to, or even stopped working. Cleaning, as it turned out, is what is needed. With a metal brush, I cleaned both filters, in the hand holder and in the "boiler outlet". For latter I need a screw driver. Then I "descale" the machine by running through the machine white vinegar mixed with water, following the steps described in the manual. Now, it's running like new. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: ZG

customer_reviews.title: Amazing espresso. Mix the grind 50% fine and 50% medium/fine
customer_reviews.text: This espresso machine is unbelievable. Almost comparable to my girlfriends $650 breville machine for much less cost. I recommend mixing your grind with a 50% fine espresso grind and other 50% medium\fine grind. (I have Starbucks do it for me) it will flow perfect and give you the perfect cup every time! I just wish the unit wasn’t made in China but unfortunately that’s the way the world is nowadays.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: best espresso maker on the market in its class.
customer_reviews.text: my current delonghi is my second one. I know some people say this breaks after 18 mos - 2 years, but my first one in the same model lasted with daily use for about 9 years. I purchased this one after that one went, and after i had a bout with trying out a nespresso machine. I am just not into the pod model. I love this machine and if you do the math, even if the machine does wear out after about 2 years, this thing still pays for itself easily. Also - I got my mom one and we did the amazon 4 year protection plan they offer. Why not do that?
customer_reviews.author: galina h.

customer_reviews.title: Good machine
customer_reviews.text: I am new at making expresso. Instructions really good, I still can't get a thick creama on top yet, but enjoy trying. My only concern is the plastic nozzle on steamer keeps stripping the threads it should be metal stainless steel and steamer pipe should be longer. The water holder handle broke when I pushed down on it to lock it in place.
customer_reviews.author: jshove77

customer_reviews.title: Product fails just after 1-year warranty expires
customer_reviews.text: I followed all of the preventative maintenance on this device (cleaning the boiler outlet, descaling, etc.) and the machine stopped making espresso just after the 1-year warranty ended. I am very disappointed and I would not buy this product again. Fortunately, the steamer still works so at least I won't have totally wasted my money. No idea what caused the espresso machine to fail (the pump still makes noise), but I honestly think this machine is designed with parts that fail after 1 year.
customer_reviews.author: speedyreader

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for the first year!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this espresso maker with such fabulous reviews and price point i couldn't refuse. It worked great for the first year and was easy to use after that I started noticing the pump was degrading and began to just drip. I went thru several cleaning cycles over the course of the year but sadly is just a drip coffee maker now. I would recommend getting the warranty if you want this to last over a year. Also the base only fits small cups around 3 inch height it would be nice to be able to fit taller size cups.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mattos

customer_reviews.title: First time espresso users only
customer_reviews.text: I was once a barista, so I know what I am doing. This machine was the cheapest I could find for an at home espresso machine. I tried it 4 times and each time I did not like the consistency of the espresso. Nor did I like the steamer, as it is too short and you can not angle the steam cup to get the right froth/foam. I can’t say it was entirely bad though. If you have never made espresso before, you may like this. I, on the other hand returned it because my espresso skills outdo the machines capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia

customer_reviews.title: Decent while it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: I got about 8 months use out of this before the pump died. During that time, it was trouble-free and I was satisfied with the espresso it produced, even though the espresso could not really compare with that produced by more expensive machines or even a Nespresso machine. On the plus side, it was cheap, although I did splurge for an after-market tamper. The two stars I subtracted were really because even a cheap machine should last at least a year, especially considering that I made, on average, only one cup per day.
customer_reviews.author: L. Barry

customer_reviews.title: Makes an amazing espresso drink/ bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: Makes an amazing espresso drink, although buy a real tamper, the one attached is useless. Wish there was a higher clearance to fit a taller cup but that's a small complaint. Overall, a great little espresso maker. Terrribe customer service drops this to 2 stars. Machine was clogging up after 6 months and I couldn't budge the screw to take it apart to clean it. Delonghi customer service said not to worry about and just descale the unit so it stays clean. I said it's defective because I can't take it apart as shown on the manual, they offered no solutions. Cheap company with poor customer service bad warranty policy. Buy at your own risk.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: It's a decent expresso machine but............
customer_reviews.text: This seller sent me a pre-owned machine that came from Target. The item demonstrated signs of being used because there were remnants of coffee grounds left on the machine. If you don't have a 2 to 3 oz expresso cup, then you will have trouble fitting the cup under the spout without removing the bottom guard. Positives: coffee that comes out is superbly much more smoother than from my Mr Coffee machine.
customer_reviews.author: Michael SFC (Ret)

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, and totally fine espresso drink maker.
customer_reviews.text: So far this machine is working fine. It is very short and stubby. Trying to figure out how to use the steam wand in a way that doesn't force me to dump and spill each time to get it out from under the wand. I wanted something cheap and easy that would get me from point A- having no expresso to point B- having some sort of expresso drink...and quickly. For those mornings when I didn't have time to stop at the local joint. And also to save a few bucks. I'll still be craving the professionally made drinks with the little flower leaves and hearts, but this will do just fine in the mean time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great machine on a budget
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this thing. It makes a GREAT espresso machine especially on a budget. The clearance between the spout/milk frother and the platform is rather small but I just got espresso cups and the milk frother can be moved. There is no timer so you have to manually turn it off when you're done brewing but it's pretty fast so that doesn't really matter anyway
customer_reviews.author: MLY

customer_reviews.title: Totally love it.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fantastic. We make lattes with it all the time. For the price, it seriously cannot be beat. Other reviewers are suggesting this metal stainless steel frothing pitcher:If you want to make Venti-sized drinks, don't bother. It's too small. The pitcher fits great under the frother, but it's not enough volume. It may be 12 ounces right up to the rim, but the liquid expands and will overflow. We have saved bunches of money by making drinks at home instead of going to St*rbuck$. We purchased it in November of 2015 and it's still going strong. The frothing wand is a little low, but so far that's really the only drawback we've some across using this machine.
customer_reviews.author: D. Slattery

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money. Coffee wasted
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love it. I had one similar back home in Europe but here they don’t carry the brand. So I went with this one. Nothing like the espresso I’m used to. No matter how much coffee I put it always seems so watery and smells weird. And I’ve used all kinds of coffee. Also it may seem like not a big deal, it’s next to impossible to find a cup that will fit under it. I’ve bought the tiniest espresso cups out there and I still have to remove the bottom to fit it. I stopped using it now. It just ruins it for me. May stop loving coffee for good if I keep using it.
customer_reviews.author: Tetiana Zelinska

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: As of this writing we have it for five days and used it twice a day. Good price, small footprint on the counter, and some convenience features in the design. There is a learning curve so spend some time with the informative and comprehensive manual that accompanies it. No complaints as it has lived up to its well established brand name.
customer_reviews.author: Amazin' Rally

customer_reviews.title: Save your money!
customer_reviews.text: This makes coffee flavored water. I have been making mochas and lattes at home for roughly 20 years and this machine is loud and the coffee comes out tan. I follow the instructions everytime. The handle takes great strength to remove and put back on. So much so that my husband has to do it for me. I use freshly ground espresso beans and filtered water. I let it warm up. Also steamer takes so long that by the time the milk is warm, the coffee is cold. Will not look at this company ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this used!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this used. I have had two used and inspected machines. The first one looked great and worked for about a month and a half. The second one showed up wet, with old milk in the frother and not working. When I contacted Amazon to return the first one, they gave me the number to De'Longhi. De'longhi said this machine in not fixable, it is replaceable. There is no point in buying used, because De'longhi will replace any that are bought new, but not the machines that are purchased used. It's much more worth the time and money to buy it new. We plan to purchase a new one, if it works I will update.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Issues with delivery
customer_reviews.text: We have owned this machine before and we’re having issues with the reservoir leaking water all over the counter. We ordered a new one. The first delivery was literally left in the rain... did not turn on. Received a replacement and the boxes are dry with the machine being wet!!! What is that?! Needless to say I am returning this item and am not reordering. Almost as if box was opened and water was poured into the machine, boxes are dry... odd.
customer_reviews.author: Flat Floors Tile

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't even work!
customer_reviews.text: First, the instructions are bad, like pictures out of order bad. I finally learned to use it by watching YouTube. Heated up nice & quick, steamer worked well. Then I went to put a cup under the coffee...and a cup won't even fit! OK, so I got a little teacup out. I turned on the espresso, and it was LOUD! Like, the rest of the house WILL be woken up when you're trying to make coffee loud. Not only that, but nothing came out! I tried Googleing the answer & it seems like a common problem but the only answer said to keep it running. 5 minutes of the horrendous loud and still nothing. I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Bruhns

customer_reviews.title: Nice Machine & Great espresso!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, the only downfall is there is a lot of steam keep a dish towel or paper towel handy when you’re steaming and cleaning” great pressure / great espresso friends and family who have had espresso from all over the world agree it’s a great machine. ( Quit Starbucks! Stay home & Save $ LOL ) definitely a great investment !
customer_reviews.author: Best Life ‘

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent frothing of milk after a few months
customer_reviews.text: Machine is great actually. But after 4 months of use, frother isnt working well and the steam is inconsistent. I cleaned it with citric acid as instructed from the manual. Unfortunately, it only worked for a week. I called an agent to return the product. And yes, product is still with me. Been waiting for 2 months for the courier to pick it up. Liters of milk wasted. Nevertheless, amazon didnt neglected me. They gave me a good compensation. Thank you AMAZON.
customer_reviews.author: emerson dela cruz

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and buy a better machine - you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this machine based on the 6,000 plus reviews and its overall 4-star rating and after a few uses I will definitely be returning it. The espresso comes out weak and the frother basically makes a little foam without much more. This is a cheap machine and that is evident in the cheap price. I guess if you want a basic espresso machine and don't care for taste and quality, this will do. But don't be swayed by the 4 or 5 star reviews - at most this machine deserves an overall 3-star rating. Better to save your money and buy a better quality latte/ espresso maker than throw away $100 at a cheap espresso maker.
customer_reviews.author: Helga Hakimi

customer_reviews.title: Affordable quality coffee
customer_reviews.text: When my expensive coffee maker broke down after a year of use, and trying to get it back to work proved more expensive, I decided on this little De’Longhi which is less than a third the price. So far it makes the same quality espressos and cappuccinos and I figure I can replace it should it ever fail with less pain in the pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel S

customer_reviews.title: Steam wand constantly on after 2.5 Months of use
customer_reviews.text: After owning the EC155 for just 2.5 months, and using it a couple of times a week, it now always has the steam wand on. While heating and while trying to make espresso. I tried descaling it per their recommendation after initial contact with customer support. They're follow up response was to mail it to Chicago on my dime to have it repaired. This is a huge safety issue as scalding hot steam will spray from the wand when it shouldn't. Based on this experience I will not be purchasing another De'Longhi product and will recommend others to avoid them as well.
customer_reviews.author: Marco

customer_reviews.title: Great for 2 1/2 years
customer_reviews.text: I have used this once or twice a day for 2 years, and it has worked well until now. It just started leaking water from the bottom of the machine. I am guessing from reading online that O-rings have worn out, so now I need to decide if it is cheaper and easier to repair it or buy a new one. The only maintenance I have done is descaling once or twice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great machine!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine in 2008 to save money on daily lattes from Dunkin' Donuts. Ten years later, I still use it 5 or more times a week and with regular cleanings, I have never had a problem. I'm not a coffee aficionado, so I'm not sure that I can comment on the quality of the espresso this machine produces. I just know that I like the espresso that comes out of this machine when I have the beans I love. If you are a coffee lover, but not a coffee snob, this is your machine.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Jay

customer_reviews.title: great espresso machine
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased Espresso machine over a yr, exactly in may/2019 and still working great. I love this machine for my morning coffee. The only complain is the smell that creates in the water tank if I don't clean every 3 months or so. It doesn't take much room. Other than that, I definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: P.Chung

customer_reviews.title: Good Starter -- trial and error taste learning curve
customer_reviews.text: Bought this two years ago, not expecting it to last. It has; but, after learning the idiosyncrasies of the machine to give a predictable pull, we want something more. Others have said the cons; true, but each can be "overcome". Heat for at least 15 minutees in advance and then purge slightly into the cup -- only emptying after the basket has been filled with burr ground coffee and tamped with a accessory purchased tamper. Obey the green light. Consume immediately. This machine lasts and is a great intro model. It now goes to my son as we migrate up.
customer_reviews.author: RLW01 -- Los Angeles

customer_reviews.title: No reason not to buy this you love coffee
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This thing was such a great buy. Why?: - Makes great espresso - assuming you're using good beans :) - It lasts. I've had this for almost 2 years and hundreds of pulls. - Easy to clean (coffee holder and water dispenser screens can be dismantled for complete cleaning) - Great price - Has more than paid for itself by saving trips to the coffee shop. - Can be used to make espresso, iced coffees, lattes, cappuccinos, americanos, machiatos, ... Note: Just recently, 7/2016, pulls started slowing. A thorough cleaning was all it needed. The coffee strainers can be completely disassembled for cleaning. The top strainer in the water dispenser can also be removed for cleaning as well.
customer_reviews.author: S. P.

customer_reviews.title: Not a complete product.
customer_reviews.text: The product needs to include a proper tamper. If you can get the needed 35 lbs or so of force to pack the grounds using the attached tamper you are a lot stronger than I am. I am a retired mason and my hands are not exactly weak. Otherwise, it is a nice high pressure espresso and cappucino maker for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: cosmo2

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed maching
customer_reviews.text: I have used several different espresso machines over the years and I have to say, the person who designed this one was asleep at the wheel. From the poorly placed steam/hot water tube (absolutely the worst), to the useless tamper, to the poorly designed function selector knob, I really dislike this machine. Coffee is average, but other than than, skip this one. I purchased this to temporarily replace another DeLonghi machine, and I would not recommend this machine to anyone, and would never purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Loved it so much I got another
customer_reviews.text: I love this espresso maker so much that this is my second one! I used my previous one for years and made over 1000 espressos and mochas using this machine. I wore the first one out! The frother works great and does a good job of getting my milk very hot. Great price; I could buy one for a lot more, but why?
customer_reviews.author: KelLin

customer_reviews.title: We love our little espresso machine!!
customer_reviews.text: I love my new little espresso maker!! We went back and forth on buying this one or the $400 one, and we're happy we went with this one. I'm sure the more expensive one makes a great coffee, but for a young couple in their mid 20s - this does the trick just fine! We ended up also buying a tapper, a set of 2 espresso glasses, and a metal milk pitcher - but all and all, I think we spent $85. 3 months now, and I've just about mastered making mochas! (Buy a jug a Monin chocolate syrup, if mochas are your morning jam).
customer_reviews.author: Alec

customer_reviews.title: Has incontinence
customer_reviews.text: Compact, attractive, but drips all over the place - from the head basket, from the steamer (when not in use). Using only ESE pods, tried multiple brands to see if it helped with the leaking from the head, no luck. Edit: Leaked from head with Caffe Mercanti and Lucaffe Pulcinella. It appears to not be leaking with Lavazza gran espresso. Looking at pods side by side with the Lucaffe, Lavazza does appear thinner. Still leaks from frother though. It works, just constantly wiping up after it. Like we have a baby in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for A Newbie to Espresso Machines
customer_reviews.text: This machine was perfect for a newbie like myself to the espresso game. It's so easy to use! It makes a perfect cup everytime and it is so affordable! I I would sincerely recommend this to anyone who is thinking about getting their first espresso machine but really doesn't know how do you make espresso. I did quite a bit of research before getting this one and honestly, I thought the prices were ridiculous for these machines that seem super complicated to use or didn't have the best reviews and they were so hundreds of dollars. I am extremely happy with my DeLonghi
customer_reviews.author: Labrizzy

customer_reviews.title: My backup/ travel espresso maker
customer_reviews.text: Very simple design. Have the larger deLonghi espresso maker. Been 5 years and still like new. This model is much less expensive yet has the 15 bar pressure. It does not have auto stop, so you will need to turn off when light indicates. Great value Espresso machine with deLonghi reputation.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal reader

customer_reviews.title: Dead, dead, dead
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these in 2011 for $75 and it leaked to death. I bought another in 2012 for $92 and it leaked to death. Now I need an espresso machine and these cost $100 and people say they're still leaking to death. Can anyone recommend a better machine that also takes ESE pods?
customer_reviews.author: Faking Faker

customer_reviews.title: I am very much satisfied with the quality of the espresso
customer_reviews.text: I bought this highly rated budget expresso machine after a trip to Italy last year. I am very much satisfied with the quality of the espresso. However, it is more accurate to call it an expresso and lotte maker instead of an expresso and cappuccino maker. The frother does not make enough form for cappuccino, especially micro form. Warning: don't listen to the online articles and videos about making modifications to the machine to improve either the quality of expresso or the form. They don't work or not worth the effort. Just keep the machine clean and tidy and enjoy your espresso and lotte. They are not perfect, but good enough.
customer_reviews.author: Bigfoot

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: The steam wand is too short and the frothing attachment in integrated in such a way that you can't just not use it, so the milk is too frothy before it is hot enough. Also, a pain to clean. The filter basket is too persnickity, and a drag to clean. Thereis too little height below the filter to allow for anything but shot glasses, so if you prefer to make your espresso directly into your cup, you're out of luck. It is a good looking and compact unit, probably just dandy if you only plan to use it once in a while, but not a good pick for daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Shana

customer_reviews.title: That's just not good enough, so I will not repurchase this model
customer_reviews.text: My machine lasted a little over a year before the pump failed. If you read the other customer reviews, you might think this model was designed to fail right after the warranty expires. It is cheap and it does make a passable cup of espresso, but be forewarned, this machine does not last long. If you're trying to save money by skipping the coffee shop and making espresso at home (like me), keep in mind that this will basically cost you $70 a year just to have an EC155 that works. That's just not good enough, so I will not repurchase this model.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Augustine Ferrin

customer_reviews.title: Bad product and customer service- NOT WORTH IT!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I received the coffee machine and followed instructions of operation. The machine produced loud noise and no hot water or coffee would come out. The package was missing the powder sachet that is used to release air pockets. The machine is malfunctioned. I contacted Delonghi customer service through their online chat platform. and the lady was so rude and unhelpful, I just spent $80 on a malfunctioning device. Amazon instructed me to contact Delonghi and issued a discount, but this will not cover my loss. not worth it !!!
customer_reviews.author: Omar

customer_reviews.title: It worked fine only for about 1 year
customer_reviews.text: It is OK machine for about 1 year, but I guess for the 80$ price this is what you can expect. Right now after an year of usage a few critical parts are failing. #1 The pump(right now it barely makes any pressure). #2 Froth Dispenser - there are some plastic parts in the handle which cannot be cleaned and also there has some spring that is stuck. Still I guess it is OK, because it made about 300-400 espressos (for about an year). Doing the math ... 80$(for the machine) + 100$ (12 months coffee) = 180$. So it is about 0.50$ per day for espresso.
customer_reviews.author: remal

customer_reviews.title: It spewed smoke
customer_reviews.text: It began spewing smoke after a year of showing no problems. I have written the company and they have not replied though I wrote them a month ago. Still waiting.
customer_reviews.author: barbara a. luttrell

customer_reviews.title: Beware of the
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't in my door more than 10 minutes before I realized what a seriously design flawed machine I bought. I read the frothier was LOW....but to be only 3 5/16" off the counter top leaves me with very few container options. If you want espresso you have to wait 15 minutes to pre-heat THEN you can start the espresso making process. Basically, it should have come with container necessary to froth and it should have clearly stated- "always have a spare 15 minutes to make your coffee. The coffee dispenser clearance is also on the low side but not as bad as the espresso and frothier.
customer_reviews.author: marcelo

customer_reviews.title: Machine stopped working after 3 or 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Dear Seller, We have some very serious issues with our coffee maker. The 1st machine stopped working after 3 or 4 months. The espresso portion of the coffee maker did not last and started dripping some espresso, but mainly water. The milk frother doesn't work properly neither. We Called and after multiple attempt to troubleshoot the issue, the technician agreed to send us a new machine, which we've received yesterday and tried it today. However, we have similar issue, even worse. Coffee is not dripping at all this time. How can we return the machine and get our money back to purchase something different? Thanks, Sincerely, Emmanuel
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuel Agbovi

customer_reviews.title: Been using it since 2011. That almost 10 years.
customer_reviews.text: I love this espresso maker. It works great and easy to use and clean. Only issue is that it does not have enough clearance for a coffee cup but you can brew your espresso in an espresso cup and transfer to a bigger coffee cup after. Also, if you want to use the milk frother, place the espresso machine on a trivet or elevated surface, near the sink so you can put the milk frothing jug under the steam nozzle and have enough room to tilt and etc. Great machine. Buy the DeLonghi coffee cleaner and use it once in a while. Bought it for $80 back in 2011 and it has paid for itself over a 100times.
customer_reviews.author: Maliha Fatima

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the money
customer_reviews.text: My prior machine was a $500 plus Breville, which was great while it lasted. Was looking for something more reasonable to take its place. Did a lot of research and this was the perfect match and it's holding up very well. Does everything the Breville did at a fifth of the cost!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: basic machine
customer_reviews.text: Pros: easy to use, and easy to clean. Decent espresso--nothing fancy. Not a whole lot of dimension. But at this price--you're really just going for bare bones. Cons: you'll get decent milk frothing capabilities, but microfoam isn't going to be a thing here. When pulling espresso, it's quite loud & doesn't automatically stop. Summary--- Buy this if: you want to make lattes, cappuccinos, espresso shots etc. without breaking the bank & you aren't looking for the best tasting espresso ever. Don't buy this: if you want to make latte art.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Does what i want it to do.
customer_reviews.text: I don't think you can beat this espresso machine for the price. I use it all the time. If you were serving drinks at a coffee shop I could see it wouldn't be enough, but it is so small, it fits and works great in my crowded kitchen. I've already got my money's worth and I haven't had it for 2 months yet.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Owens

customer_reviews.title: Vibrations were too strong
customer_reviews.text: The machine shook so much during the espresso process that I had to hold in place before it went over the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Review Extraordinaire

customer_reviews.title: Was not a good purchase for me
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure I received a defective one. The espresso was weak, the water was lukewarm. After a couple months the water stopped working altogether. Because I trusted the brand I trashed the packing materials when I bought it, so money down the drain for me. But if you get one that works, I'm sure it's a nice machine.
customer_reviews.author: Meesh

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the plastic its made of
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this espresso machine it is cheaply built. It has a very noisy vibrating motor in base of the machine which in return does not allow the coffee cup to stay in place to catch the coffee which then causes a huge mess. The loud winding nose of the motor in this coffee maker is enough to wake you up and keep you up..never mind making the coffee. Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Studio 67

customer_reviews.title: Pump fails quickly.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one in April 2015. Pump died two years later. Bought another one in June 2017. Pump started going in the past few months. Now dead. Still under warranty; so, we shall see. Overall, a good little espresso maker; but, not if the pump lasts only a year ... or less. I'm an engineer. I know something about equipment. Pump was not abused. Just two single cups per day, at most. Never run empty.
customer_reviews.author: Nick L

customer_reviews.title: U get what u pay for
customer_reviews.text: It’s good for the money, I’m not giving it 5 star because the water tank came broken and I didn’t want to bother returning it for that. The other reason why I won’t give it 5 stars is because the space to fit a coffee cup is really small so I had trouble I had to purchase 3 different sizes to find the one it fits.
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: You will get weak & bitter espresso!
customer_reviews.text: The basket where you put the espresso is WAY too small. A double shot requires a minimum of 15 grams of grinded espresso and this basket holds barley 11-12 grams so all you’re left with it is weak disgusting espresso. I’ve had cheaper espresso machines that held more than this and done a way better job. Should have just bought those instead of this. Also, the steaming wand is horribly short and spews out so much water that my milk ended up getting watered down! Ridiculous!
customer_reviews.author: Stella

customer_reviews.title: Good but need to improve
customer_reviews.text: There are the pros and cons here. The product is easy to use and clean. However, the pressure is not as strong as I read so the coffee it makes is just ok. I would recommend adding more pressure and make it a little heavier to make it stand still when installing the handler.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Not working for me
customer_reviews.text: I am really disappointed with this little machine. I have had it for only 2 weeks and it is already having problems. The espresso is coming out in a slow drip and not producing any crema. As well, the green light goes on and off throughout making the espresso, even when I have preheated it for 30 mins. I think I will have to return this
customer_reviews.author: lovely9

customer_reviews.title: Been very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this machine over 5 years ago. Been very happy with it! I do believe it is starting to fail but for the $80 I paid for it we can't complain. Excellent deal, will buy DeLonghi again for sure. The key with the longevity of these machines is to use purified water. Hard water deposits are a killer for this type of stuff.
customer_reviews.author: johnsmith

customer_reviews.title: Serves the purpose, and a good espresso,  at a decent price
customer_reviews.text: This was a good model and served the purpose. It created a nice espresso with great creama. The main problem I had with it was I had to buy a new one every year. You also had to let the pressure release before removing the filter holder, otherwise grounds would go everywhere. So there is a small learning curve. It's a good 15 bar maker for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl R.

customer_reviews.title: The Best (Cheap) Espresso Maker Out There
customer_reviews.text: Tired of paying $5 each morning for a latte, I decided to invest a small amount of coin in this DeLonghi. Some of the 1-star reviews didn’t intimate, having spent $600 on my previous machine a decade ago, that lasted only 2 years. Seriously, if it breaks down in a year I’m still saving money. So far this machine is a great little workhorse and makes a perfect latte. Beautiful crema, impressive foam, it’s small, it’s cheap, and easy to you use. No regrets after 4 months of daily use. It’s already paid for itself in the first month.
customer_reviews.author: Siren3

customer_reviews.title: Leaking Water Reservoir
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to keep this. Bec it actually makes decent expresso but the water reservoir starts leaking in less than a month. This is the 2nd one that I got. Ist one the bottom plastic was broken when it came in so I decided to exchange it thinking it was that issue only dye to shipping. But dissappointed again.
customer_reviews.author: Fc

customer_reviews.title: Nice machine with a couple design flaws
customer_reviews.text: Makes great espresso and cappuccino BUT the milk frother retracts back in making for difficult removal of the coffee holder... and it is difficult to move when hot. Update: after 16 months the boiler and pump started having issues. Yes, I descaled it per instructions. Not a heavy use item, but it made great drinks for over a year. Just wish it would have lasted longer. Thankfully I bought the Square Trade warranty.
customer_reviews.author: MikeeLikesItOrNot

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: This product is the perfect example of don't buy cheap stuff! The thing vibrates so much it feels and sounds like it's falling apart. I think I got a total of maybe 15 brews and now it doesn't even brew properly. It takes forever with tiny drops slowly dripping into the espresso cups. Don't waste your money, you'll be disappointed. Spend a little more on a better machine and save yourself the wasted time and money. Not sure if all the original reviews were bought and paid for, or people used it 1 time and thought it was just the best thing... but it's a cheaply made and unstable/unreliable way to make espresso.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: good for beginner but not what you want for life
customer_reviews.text: like others have said a great starter machine but not 1 to keep for life the space is so short you cant put anything underneath except shot glasses for the espresso... honestly the steamer is short too so you have to prop it up and have a shallower milk frothing cup to use properly
customer_reviews.author: Cloud

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this exactly one year ago. In that one year of ownership, we've only gone through one bag of espresso grounds, which is to say it has not seen an overabundance of use. I never felt the milk steamer worked especially well, but it made espresso, so it is what it is. I finally bought more espresso grounds and made two drinks with it. I went to make a third and it was no longer working. The espresso began spewing out the sides of the grounds container and steam was coming out of it at the sides. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: NOT for me...
customer_reviews.text: RARELY do I leave negative feedback but had to share. NOT impressed with this machine. At all. Even though I follow the instructions in the manual, the water never seems to heat up to a temperature to make a good espresso. There were no containers included to hold the espresso and I struggled to find a container small enough to fit under the machine to catch the espresso. Way too much crema...more like FOAM, not crema! I tried different coffees to trouble shoot...it''s the machine. Had a cheaper one than this De Longhi that did a much better job...
customer_reviews.author: 🤘MusicLover🤘

customer_reviews.title: leaks a lot just after 6 months and got a replacement within 9 days.
customer_reviews.text: Update: I found customer care was very friendly and updated 4-star. Chafik sent me a video link and checked my machine, and then told me that he would send me a replacement on condition to cut cord off and send him the picture. I did all he told me and got a new machine after 9 days. Thank you and hope this one works long time. ---- At first It worked well. just after 6 months, it suddenly started leaking a lot of water at the bottom. Tried to clean up according to menu, but could not stop it. Cannot use it any more.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Jin

customer_reviews.title: awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Received this wonderful machine today. Have made 5 espressos and 3 cappuccino. They turned out perfect. There is a bit of a learning curve, but if you know the basics this machine will work fine. My first two pucks were a little wet, however I adjusted the quantity and pressure and subsequent pucks were nice and firm with a scant amount of moisture, as they should be. The 12oz pitcher works fine. I will add more as I use it. Hopefully the longevity of the machine will match the performance. This is a really good entry espresso machine. Follow the instructions and you will be good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little machine IF you depressurize the portafilter
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little machine IF you depressurize the portafilter. (a simple 2 minute job that can be accomplished with a pair of pliers, search youtube) As it is the machine was designed to use nasty pre-ground coffee that requires a pressurized portfilter to make crema. With a decent grinder like a Baratza Encore and good, fresh beans, this machine will make perfect espresso shots. I found using setting of "10" on the Encore with very light tamping produced the best shots from my machine.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great but loud and shakes
customer_reviews.text: I love i can taste the actual flavor difference of coffee.I always thought shit was a default taste.The only thing i hate is that it shakes the cup ridiculously so i have to watch that the cup doesnt move from under the pour spots.And its pretty loud like an air pump. But its a whole new coffee experience.I rarely drink coffee outside the house now.My home made is always better.I have already saved 3x what it cost.Literally giving myself hypertension here.Somebody stop me cause my heart will..lol
customer_reviews.author: Texacano
